name: contentConnector
description: The following functions can be associated to a service task and use the Content Connector to execute actions on ACS.

38ea5b8b-fdee-4c44-a604-40446f46a568.name: EXECUTE_ACTION
38ea5b8b-fdee-4c44-a604-40446f46a568.description:
Executes an action. An action may be executed against a file or a folder. In the future, actions may be executed against different entity types or
executed without the need for the context of an entity. Actions are executed asynchronously. The response contains an id that can be tracked

inputs.name: actionDefinitionId
inputs.description: ID of the action to be executed. E.g: "copy".

inputs.name: file
inputs.description: ACS file that the action is executed against. File variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers. E.g: 'Initialise a file variable by mapping it to the output of the generate document task.'

inputs.name: folder
inputs.description: ACS folder that the action is executed against. Folder variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers.

inputs.name: path
inputs.description: Path of the node in ACS. E.g: '/User Homes/hruser/invoices'

inputs.name: nodeId
inputs.description:
Node ID of the file or folder in ACS. Example:
'a6a977a6-c728-4038-8dbc-d914c4d8cfb3'

inputs.name: params
inputs.description: Parameters to be passed to the action. Key-Value pair map.

63fa0f9d-e055-42ee-9db6-59ba5c04c67d.name: ADD_SECURITY_MARKS
63fa0f9d-e055-42ee-9db6-59ba5c04c67d.description: Add security marks to a node

inputs.name: file
inputs.description: ACS file to be updated. File variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers. E.g: 'Initialise a file variable by mapping it to the output of the generate document task.'

inputs.name: folder
inputs.description: ACS folder to be updated. Folder variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers.

inputs.name: path
inputs.description: Path of the node in ACS. E.g: '/User Homes/hruser/invoices'

inputs.name: nodeId
inputs.description:
Node ID of the file or folder in ACS. Example:
'a6a977a6-c728-4038-8dbc-d914c4d8cfb3'

inputs.name: securityGroupName
inputs.description: Security group that contains the security marks to be assigned. E.g: 'PII'

inputs.name: securityMarks
inputs.description: Array including the name of the security marks to be added.

fec2f0a3-2af5-4940-9293-1b9d50a7586d.name: GET_SECURITY_MARKS
fec2f0a3-2af5-4940-9293-1b9d50a7586d.description: Get security marks of a node

inputs.name: file
inputs.description: ACS file from which security maks are retrieved. File variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers. E.g: 'Initialise a file variable by mapping it to the output of the generate document task.'

inputs.name: folder
inputs.description: ACS folder from which security maks are retrieved. Folder variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers.

inputs.name: path
inputs.description: Path of the node in ACS. E.g: '/User Homes/hruser/invoices'

inputs.name: nodeId
inputs.description:
Node ID of the file or folder in ACS. Example:
'a6a977a6-c728-4038-8dbc-d914c4d8cfb3'

inputs.name: securityGroupName
inputs.description: Security group that contains the security marks to be retrieved. E.g: 'PII'

outputs.name: securityMarks
outputs.description: Array including security marks of the node for the provided security group.

inputs.name: file
inputs.description: ACS file to be declared as record. File variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers. E.g: 'Initialise a file variable by mapping it to the output of the generate document task.'

inputs.name: fileId
inputs.description: Node ID of the folder in ACS. Example: 'a6a977a6-c728-4038-8dbc-d914c4d8cfb3'

inputs.name: filePath
inputs.description: Path of the node in ACS. E.g: '/User Homes/hruser/invoices'

inputs.name: targetFolder
inputs.description: Destination record folder in which to store the result. Folder variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers.

inputs.name: targetFolderPath
inputs.description: Path of the destination record folder to use to store the result. E.g. '/User Homes/hruser'

inputs.name: targetFolderId
inputs.description: ACS node id of the destination record folder to use to store the result. E.g: '775a8f2d-8123-49a7-ae1f-f3f49d4eae20'

inputs.name: hideRecord
inputs.description: Flag to indicate whether the record should be hidden from the current parent folder.

inputs.name: file
inputs.description: ACS file to be updated. File variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers. E.g: 'Initialise a file variable by mapping it to the output of the generate document task.'

inputs.name: folder

Node ID of the file or folder in ACS. Example:
'a6a977a6-c728-4038-8dbc-d914c4d8cfb3'

inputs.name: users
inputs.description: Array of user names. E.g. 'hruser'

inputs.name: role
inputs.description: Role of the user. E.g. 'Coordinator'

inputs.name: file
inputs.description: ACS file to be updated. File variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers. E.g: 'Initialise a file variable by mapping it to the output of the generate document task.'

inputs.name: folder
inputs.description: ACS folder to be updated. Folder variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers.

inputs.name: aspect

inputs.description: ACS file to be updated. File variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers. E.g: 'Initialise a file variable by mapping it to the output of the generate document task.'

inputs.name: folder

inputs.name: path

Node ID of the file or folder in ACS. Example:

inputs.name: aspect
inputs.description: Aspect to be assigned to the node. E.g: 'rv:reviewable'

inputs.name: nodeMetadata
inputs.description: Metadata to be set to the node in ACS. Metadata is a JSON object that contains key-value pairs, each of them holding a property name (e.g. 'cm:title') and a property value (e.g: 'Introduction to AWS')

inputs.name: underscoreMetadata
inputs.description: If underscoreMetadata is true, the received prefixed properties names contain underscore (_) instead of colon (:) for separating the namespace prefix from the property name. E.g. 'cm_title' instead of 'cm:title'.

inputs.name: file
inputs.description: ACS file to be unlocked. File variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers. E.g: 'Initialise a file variable by mapping it to the output of the generate document task.'

inputs.name: folder

inputs.name: nodeId

'a6a977a6-c728-4038-8dbc-d914c4d8cfb3'

inputs.name: lockType
inputs.description: Lock type. Valid values are 'FULL', 'ALLOW_OWNER_CHANGES' or 'ALLOW_ADD_CHILDREN'

inputs.name: lifetime
inputs.description: Lifetime of the lock. Valid values are 'EPHEMERAL' or 'PERSISTENT'

inputs.name: timeToExpire
inputs.description: Time (in second) after which the lock is expired. E.g. '1200'

inputs.name: sourceFile
inputs.description: ACS file to be included as node content. File variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers.

inputs.name: sourceText
inputs.description: Source text to be included as node content.

inputs.name: sourceJson
inputs.description: Source json to be included as node content.

inputs.name: targetFile
inputs.description: ACS file to be overwritten after the action. File variables are initialised by content actions or content events.

inputs.name: targetFileId
inputs.description:
Node ID of the file to be updated in ACS. E.g:
'a6a977a6-c728-4038-8dbc-d914c4d8cfb3'

inputs.name: targetFilePath
inputs.description: Path of the node to be updated in ACS. E.g: '/User Homes/hruser/invoices/invoice.txt'

inputs.name: versionComment
inputs.description: Version comment to appear in the version history. E.g: 'Minor changes after final review by Management'

inputs.name: majorVersion
inputs.description: If **true**, create a major version.

inputs.name: newName
inputs.description: Optional new name of the file to be updated. It shall include the file extension. E.g: 'newName.txt'

inputs.name: file
inputs.description: ACS file to be read. File variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers. E.g: 'Initialise a file variable by mapping it to the output of the generate document task.'

inputs.name: path
inputs.description: Path of the node in ACS. E.g: '/User Homes/hruser/invoices'

inputs.name: nodeId
inputs.description:
Node ID of the file or folder in ACS. Example:
'a6a977a6-c728-4038-8dbc-d914c4d8cfb3'

inputs.name: contentType
inputs.description: Type of the content to be returned. Valid values are: 'JSON' or ' TXT'

36e29465-1e90-4889-ad95-ba9d20b907e3.name: UPDATE_METADATA
36e29465-1e90-4889-ad95-ba9d20b907e3.description: Update or add metadata to a node

inputs.name: file
inputs.description: ACS file to be updated. File variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers. E.g: 'Initialise a file variable by mapping it to the output of the generate document task.'

inputs.name: folder
inputs.description: ACS folder to be updated. Folder variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers.

inputs.name: path
inputs.description: Path of the node in ACS. E.g: '/User Homes/hruser/invoices'

inputs.name: nodeId
inputs.description:
Node ID of the file or folder in ACS. Example:
'a6a977a6-c728-4038-8dbc-d914c4d8cfb3'

inputs.name: metadata
inputs.description: Metadata to be set to the node in ACS. Metadata is a JSON object that contains key-value pairs, each of them holding a property name (e.g. 'cm:title') and a property value (e.g: 'Introduction to AWS')

inputs.name: underscoreMetadata
inputs.description: If underscoreMetadata is true, the received prefixed properties names contain underscore (_) instead of colon (:) for separating the namespace prefix from the property name. E.g. 'cm_title' instead of 'cm:title'.

inputs.name: underscoreMetadata
inputs.description: If underscoreMetadata is true, the received prefixed properties names contain underscore (_) instead of colon (:) for separating the namespace prefix from the property name. E.g. 'cm_title' instead of 'cm:title'.

inputs.description: Name of the folder to be created.

inputs.name: autorename
inputs.description: If true, then a name clash will cause an attempt to auto rename by finding a unique name using an integer suffix.

inputs.description: ACS content type of the folder to be stored in ACS. E.g. 'fin:account'. By default, 'cm:folder'.

inputs.name: underscoreMetadata
inputs.description: If underscoreMetadata is true, the received prefixed properties names contain underscore (_) instead of colon (:) for separating the namespace prefix from the property name. E.g. 'cm_title' instead of 'cm:title'.

inputs.name: targetFileMetadata
inputs.description: Metadata to be set to the file in ACS. Metadata is a JSON object that contains key-value pairs, each of them holding a property name (e.g. 'cm:title') and a property value (e.g: 'Introduction to AWS')

inputs.name: underscoreMetadata
inputs.description: If underscoreMetadata is true, the received prefixed properties names contain underscore (_) instead of colon (:) for separating the namespace prefix from the property name. E.g. 'cm_title' instead of 'cm:title'.

inputs.description: ACS folder to be selected. Folder variables are initialised by content actions or content events in triggers.

Node ID of the file or folder in ACS. Example:
'a6a977a6-c728-4038-8dbc-d914c4d8cfb3'

inputs.name: searchQuery
inputs.description: Search query, in AFTS format, to find the resource. E.g 'cm:title:test'

inputs.name: searchMaxItems
inputs.description: Maximum number of items to be returned by the search query. By default, results are limited to 100.

inputs.name: searchSkipCount
inputs.description: Number of items to be skipped before returning the search result. By default, it is set to 0.

errors.name: MISSING_INPUT
errors.description: A mandatory input variable was not provided

errors.name: INVALID_INPUT
errors.description: The input variable has an invalid type

errors.name: INVALID_RESULT_FORMAT
errors.description: The service result payload cannot be parsed

errors.name: UNKNOWN_ERROR
errors.description: Unexpected runtime error

errors.name: BAD_REQUEST
errors.description: The server could not understand the request due to invalid syntax

errors.name: UNAUTHORIZED
errors.description: The request has not been applied because it lacks valid authentication

errors.name: FORBIDDEN
errors.description: The server understood the request but refuses to authorize it

errors.name: NOT_FOUND
errors.description: The server could not find what was requested

errors.name: METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED
errors.description: The request method is known by the server but is not supported

errors.name: NOT_ACCEPTABLE
errors.description: The server cannot produce a response matching the list of acceptable values

errors.name: REQUEST_TIMEOUT
errors.description: The server would like to shut down this unused connection

errors.name: CONFLICT
errors.description: The request conflicts with current state of the server

errors.name: GONE
errors.description: No longer available

errors.name: UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY
errors.description: The server understands the content type of the request entity, and the syntax of the request entity is correct, but it was unable to process the contained instructions

errors.name: LOCKED
errors.description: The resource that is being accessed is locked

errors.name: FAILED_DEPENDENCY
errors.description: The request failed due to failure of a previous request

errors.name: INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
errors.description: The server has encountered a situation it doesn't know how to handle

errors.name: NOT_IMPLEMENTED
errors.description: The request method is not supported by the server and cannot be handled

errors.name: BAD_GATEWAY
errors.description: The server got an invalid response

errors.name: SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE
errors.description: The server is not ready to handle the request

errors.name: GATEWAY_TIMEOUT
errors.description: The server is acting as a gateway and cannot get a response in time

errors.name: INVALID_SECURITY_MARK
errors.description: The security mark is not visible to the user or it doesn't exist
